Author: lostmybiscuit
Text: fuck that sounds really frustrating. could part of it maybe be that the scale was showing water weight/mild edema before and those things had decreased this time you weighed yourself?   there's also the possibility of increased diet-induced thermogenesis (basically many people recovering from AN convert more energy into heat instead of using it to build and repair tissue, which is also part of why some people in recovery get night sweats and feel all horribly flushed) and of [hypermetabolism](https://www.scienceofeds.org/2014/05/07/hypermetabolism-in-anorexia-nervosa/) upon starting refeeding, which can still affect people like 6+ months into recovery. but at least both do generally go away over time if you eat more and eat consistently. hang in there.
